description: From Ancient Greek ἀκτίς, ἀκτῖν- (aktís, aktîn-, “ray”)  +‎ -al. The usage was coined by Louis Agassiz (See quotations below.).

entries.meaning: (zoology) Pertaining to the side or surface around the mouth in an animal that has radial symmetry such as a starfish.
(zoology) Pertaining to the axis of rotational symmetry in radiate animals.
examples: [Professor Agassiz] gives the names of two axes of the animals; that around which the motion of the animal occurs is the actinal axis ...
